The diagram depicts an example of a hierarchical addressing scheme created using best practices. The core router is connected to four routers with /16 networks. These then connect to complex networks using the best practice hierarchical addressing schemes.

Router 10.1.0.0 /16 is connected to networks:
10.1.1.0 /24
10.1.2.0 /24
10.1.3.0 /24
10.1.4.0 /24

Router 10.2.0.0 /16 is connected to networks:
10.2.1.0 /24
10.2.2.0 /24
10.2.3.0 /24
10.2.4.0 /24
10.2.5.0 /24
10.2.6.0 /24

Router 10.3.0.0 /16 is connected to networks:
10.3.0.16 /28
10.3.0.32 /28
10.3.0.48 /28
10.3.0.64 /28

Router 10.4.0.0 /16 is connected to networks:
10.4.1 6.0 /20
10.4.3 2.0 /20
10.4.4 8.0 /20
10.4.6 4.0 /20
